column1: The class had assembled again in Professor Gray's study and all were eager to hear the second talk on Edison. There was a delay of many minutes past the hour stated
column2: but the anticipation was such that the time was hardly noticed. During the interim
column3: Professor Gray came to where Bill and Gus sat."I hear that you boys intend to go to work in the mills next week
column6: I have some news and a proposition
column7: so do not be disappointed if the beginning sounds discouraging. In the first place I saw Mr. Deering
column9: again and he told me that while he would make good his promise to take you on
column10: there would hardly be more than a few weeks' work. Orders are scarce and they expect to lay off men in August
column11: though there is likely to be a resumption of business in the early fall when you are getting back into school work. So wouldn't it be better to forego the mill work
column12: —there goes the announcement! I'll talk with you before you leave."
